verbs.description: [ARG0: Lawyer Michael Cohen] [V: told] [ARG2: a journalist] , " [ARG1: I will take you for every penny you still do n't have] , " [ARGM-TMP: in 2015] [ARGM-TMP: after the reporter wrote a story about President Donald Trump and his first wife , Ivana Trump] .

Lawyer Michael Cohen told a journalist , " I [V: will] take you for every penny you still do n't have , " in 2015 after the reporter wrote a story about President Donald Trump and his first wife , Ivana Trump .

Lawyer Michael Cohen told a journalist , " [ARG0: I] [ARGM-MOD: will] [V: take] [ARG1: you] [ARGM-PRP: for every penny you still do n't have] , " in 2015 after the reporter wrote a story about President Donald Trump and his first wife , Ivana Trump .

Lawyer Michael Cohen told a journalist , " I will take you for every penny you still [V: do] n't have , " in 2015 after the reporter wrote a story about President Donald Trump and his first wife , Ivana Trump .

Lawyer Michael Cohen told a journalist , " I will take you for [ARG1: every penny] [ARG0: you] [ARGM-TMP: still] do [ARGM-NEG: n't] [V: have] , " in 2015 after the reporter wrote a story about President Donald Trump and his first wife , Ivana Trump .

Lawyer Michael Cohen told a journalist , " I will take you for every penny you still do n't have , " in 2015 after [ARG0: the reporter] [V: wrote] [ARG1: a story about President Donald Trump and his first wife , Ivana Trump] .
